meanings.definition: Those who design sets for theatrical productions.
meanings.sent1: The talented scenographers created a stunning backdrop for the play.
meanings.sent2: The scenographers worked tirelessly to bring the director's vision to life on stage.
meanings.sent3: The scenographers decided to use giant cardboard boxes as the main set pieces, adding a whimsical touch to the production.
meanings.sent4: In the world of theater, scenographers are like painters, using the stage as their canvas.
meanings.sent5: The scenographers transformed the empty stage into a magical forest with their creative designs.

meanings.definition: The art or practice of designing sets for theatrical productions.
meanings.sent1: Learning about scenography involves understanding the history of stage design.
meanings.sent2: Scenography requires a blend of creativity and technical skill to create immersive worlds on stage.
meanings.sent3: The class on scenography turned out to be more hands-on than expected, with students building miniature sets.
meanings.sent4: In the world of theater, scenography is the silent storyteller that sets the mood for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of scenography lies in its ability to transport the audience to different places and times through visual elements.
